tit.e: Iaido (art of drawing the Japanese sword)
Iaido (art of drawing the Japanese sword)
Iaido (art of drawing the Japanese sword)

sen.j: 居合道（いあいどう）とは、武術である抜刀術・居合を武道としたものである。
sen.e: "Iaido" is a kind of martial art which was developed from battojutsu (the technique of drawing a sword) called Iai.
"Iaido" is a kind of martial art that was developed from the battojutsu (technique of drawing a sword) called Iai.
Iaido is a kind of martial art that was developed from the battojutsu (technique of drawing a sword) called Iai.
sen.cmt: ダブルクォーテーションを削除しました。

sen.j: 居合道とは、日本刀を用い、抜刀から納刀、および諸作法を通し技能の修練のみならず人格の涵養なども含めた各自による自己修練のこと。
sen.e: Iaido is a self-discipline including not only training of techniques but also maturing as a person through leaning how to use Japanese sword such as drawing, sheathing and other manners.

Iaido is a self-discipline that represents not only training in technique but also the maturing of the person by learning how to use a Japanese sword such as drawing it, sheathing it and other manners.

Iaido is a self-discipline that represents not only training in technique but also the maturing of the person by learning how to use a Japanese sword such as drawing it, sheathing it and other manners.

sen.j: 現在、座った状態で、鞘から刀剣を抜き放ち、さらに納刀に至るまでをも含めた技術を、一つの独立した武道と成している国は、全世界でも日本のみで、実は非常に稀有なものである。
sen.e: Currently, a sequence of techniques from drawing a sword to sheathing in a sitting posture is considered as an independent martial art only in Japan, in fact, it is very rare
Currently, a sequence of techniques from drawing a sword to sheathing it while in a seated position is considered as an independent martial art only in Japan, but in fact it is very rare.
Currently, a sequence of techniques from drawing a sword to sheathing it while in a seated position is considered as an independent martial art only in Japan, but in fact it is very rare.

sen.j: それぞれの団体において段級位制があり精進を重ね、形を演武し所定の審査と試験（筆記、口頭かは各団体により異なる）を経て段位及び範士、教士、錬士という称号を授かる。
sen.e: Each organization has kyu and dan grading system and a performer who works hard and performs kata (standard form of a movement, posture, etc. in martial arts, sport, etc.), then passes certain audition and examination (whether it is written or oral depends on the organization) can receive a dan-i (qualification of rank) or a title such as Hanshi (the top rank), Kyoshi (prestigious title) or Renshi (senior teacher).

Each organization has a kyu-and-dan grading system, so that a performer who works hard, performs kata (standard form of a movement, posture, etc. in martial arts, sport, etc.) and ultimately passes a certain audition and examination (whether it is written or oral depends on the organization) can receive a dan-i (qualification of rank) or a title such as Hanshi (the top rank), Kyoshi (prestigious title) or Renshi (senior teacher).

Each organization has a kyu-and-dan grading system, so that a performer who works hard, performs kata (standard form of a movement, posture, etc. in martial arts, sport, etc.) and ultimately passes a certain audition and examination (whether it is written or oral depends on the organization) can receive a dan-i (qualification of rank) or a title such as Hanshi (the top rank), Kyoshi (prestigious title) or Renshi (senior teacher).

sen.j: 級位制度は一級が最高であるが、段位制度は階段を果てしなく昇れるように修行が進むほどに数字が大きくなるように創設された。
sen.e: In kyu grading system, first kyu is the highest grade, but in dan grading system, the more advanced the training is, the larger the number of grade becomes which enable performers to go up the ladder of grades interminably.

In the kyu grading system, the first kyu is the highest grade, but in the dan grading system the more advanced the training is, the larger the number of the grade becomes, thus enabling which performers to ascend the ladder of grades interminably.

In the kyu grading system, the first kyu is the highest grade, but in the dan grading system the more advanced the training is, the larger the number of the grade becomes, thus enabling performers to ascend the ladder of grades interminably.
sen.cmt: 文法を一部修正しました。

sen.j: 現在、各団体ごとに允可最高段位を定めており、十段範士を最終段階、最終目的とする団体もある。
sen.e: Currently, each organization established authorized highest dan-i, in some organization, a Hanshi with tenth dan is the final stage and ultimate goal.
Currently, each organization has an authorized highest dan-i, but in some organizations a Hanshi of the tenth dan is the final stage and ultimate goal.
Currently, each organization has an authorized highest dan-i, but in some organizations a Hanshi of the tenth dan is the final stage and ultimate goal.
(Each organization established different goal.)
(Each organization has established a different goal.)
(Each organization has established a different goal.)
Difference from swordplay
Difference from swordplay
Difference from swordplay

sen.j: 剣術との相違点は主に床の間での想定で型が組まれている点にあり、奉納、作法を意識している点も挙げられる。
sen.e: The difference from swordplay is kata of iaido is made on the assumption that it is played on the floor.
The difference from swordplay is that the kata of iaido is made on the assumption that it's played on the floor.

The difference from swordplay is that the kata of iaido is made on the assumption that it's played on the floor; another point is that iaido puts emphasis on the awareness on drawing and sheathing the sword.
sen.cmt: 翻訳を追加しました(奉納、作法～挙げられる）。

sen.e: Enbukai (public demonstration)
Enbukai (public demonstration)
Enbukai (public demonstration)

sen.j: 主に業前（形）を披露する行事を年に数回行う。
sen.e: Enbukai is conducted several times a year mainly as an event in which performers demonstrate wazamae (kata).
Enbukai is conducted several times a year, mainly as an event in which performers demonstrate wazamae (kata).
Enbukai is conducted several times a year, mainly as an event in which performers demonstrate wazamae (kata).

sen.j: また神社にて日頃の精進の成果をご神前に報告する奉納演武を執り行うこともある。
sen.e: Also, sometimes it is conducted as a hono-enbu in order to report the result of daily training at a Shinto shrine.
Additionally, it is sometimes conducted as a hono-enbu in order to report the result of daily training at a Shinto shrine.
Additionally, it is sometimes conducted as a hono-enbu in order to report the result of daily training at a Shinto shrine.
Game
Game
Game

sen.j: 試合は実際に斬りあうのではなく、段位ごとに、各流派の形ならびに、各流派が集まる団体では共通の制定した形を加え、演武としての業前（形）を審判の旗の掲示による多数決や採点で評価することで執り行う。
sen.e: In the game of iaido, performers don't kill each other, but they perform each school's kata, if the organization includes several schools, an established kata also, then they are evaluated on the performance of wazamae (kata) and judged by majority vote using flags or grades.

In the game of iaido, performers don't kill each other but instead perform each school's kata; and if the organization includes several schools, an established kata also, whereupon they're evaluated on the performance of wazamae (kata) and judged by majority vote using flags or grades.

In the game of iaido, performers don't kill each other but instead perform each school's kata; and if the organization includes several schools, an established kata also, whereupon they're evaluated on the performance of wazamae (kata) and judged by majority vote using flags or grades.

sen.j: 高段位においては試合を行わず演武のみになる団体もある。
sen.e: In higher dan-i, some organization doesn't conduct any game, but just demonstrate performance.
In higher dan-i, some organizations don't conduct games but just conduct demonstration performances.
In higher dan-i, some organizations don't conduct games but just conduct demonstration performances.
History
History
History

sen.j: 昭和29年（1954年）5月4日、全日本居合道連盟、創立
sen.e: On May 4, 1954, All Japan Iaido Federation was founded.
On May 4, 1954, the All Japan Iaido Federation was founded.
On May 4, 1954, the All Japan Iaido Federation was founded.

sen.j: 昭和31年（1956年）、全日本剣道連盟、全日本剣道連盟居合を創設
sen.e: In 1956, All Japan Kendo Federation established All Japan Kendo Federation Iai.
In 1956, the All Japan Kendo Federation established the All Japan Kendo Federation Iai.
In 1956, the All Japan Kendo Federation established the All Japan Kendo Federation Iai.

sen.j: 昭和50年（1975年）、大日本居合道連盟、発足
sen.e: In 1975, Dai Nippon Iaido Renmei was inaugurated.
In 1975, Dai Nippon Iaido Renmei was inaugurated.
In 1975, Dai Nippon Iaido Renmei (Great Japan Iaido Federation) was inaugurated.
sen.cmt: 大日本居合道連盟→Great Japan Iaido Federation 補足を追加しました（定訳は不明です）。
